intro: Hieracium praecox subsp. medium, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow flowers with ray florets. The plant has a fibrous root system and lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. The species is known for its ability to spread vegetatively through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
